brief_description: The goals of the present study were to determine whether there is a gene expression profile that is predictive of an individual's response to the adjuvanted RTS,S malaria vaccine and to identify the time at which that profile can be discerned before challenge.
brief_title: Expression of genes associated with immunoproteasome processing of major histocompatibility complex peptides is indicative of protection with adjuvanted RTS,S malaria vaccine.
condition_studied: double blinded study to test malaria vaccine
description: Background. Patterns of expressed genes in the peripheral blood mononuclear cells of persons who were receiving RTS,S/AS01 or RTS,S/AS02 malaria vaccine and were undergoing experimental challenge with mosquito-borne falciparum malaria were examined to identify markers associated with protection.
hypothesis: The immunologic response of malaria-naive adults to vaccination with adjuvanted RTS,S shows significant individual variation: some vaccine recipients are protected, and among those who are not protected, some exhibit a delay in the development of parasitemia [1, 3?7, 11]. Protection of malaria-naive volunteers is associated with both CSP-specific antibody and T cell responses. CSP-specific CD4+ T cells associated with interleukin (IL)-2, interferon (IFN)-_, tumor necrosis factor (TNF)-_, and CD40L; anti-CSP immunoglobulin (Ig) G levels; and ex vivo CSP-specific IFN-_ enzyme-linked immunospots are observed in persons protected from malaria after challenge with infected mosquitoes [7, 12]. These immunologic markers approximate, but do not accurately predict, which of the vaccine recipients will be fully protected, will be unprotected, or will show a delay in disease onset.
intervention_agent: malaria vaccine RTS,S with ASO2A/ASO1B adjuvant
objectives: To identify expression of genes in the immunoproteasome pathway that impinge on the efficiency of MHC class 1 processing and subsequent antigen presentation, and that are differentially expressed in persons protected by the vaccine and are discerned before human challenge with the pathogen.
official_title: Expression of genes associated with immunoproteasome processing of major histocompatibility complex peptides is indicative of protection with adjuvanted RTS,S malaria vaccine.

arm.description: Subjects received adjuvanted RTS,S malaria vaccine regimen prior to malaria challenge
arm.name: adjuvanted RTS,S malaria vaccine cohort

personnel.organization: Walter Reed Army Institute of Research

pubmed.title: Expression of genes associated with immunoproteasome processing of major histocompatibility complex peptides is indicative of protection with adjuvanted RTS,S malaria vaccine.

program.contract_name: Walter Reed Army Institute of Research
